intro: Acianthera biceps, commonly known as the two-armed orchid, is a species of orchid native to South America. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, with two distinct arms or lobes on each petal. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid tropical environments. Its flowers are usually small and fragrant, often displaying a range of colors from white to pink. Acianthera biceps is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and relatively easy care requirements.
